title.narrative: Building Resilient Communities Wetland Ecosystems and As

description.narrative: The Building Resilient Communities, Wetland Ecosystems and Associated Catchments in Uganda project will restore wetlands and their ecosystem services, will support resilient agricultural practices and alternative livelihoods for communities

participating-org.narrative: UGA Min of Water and Env

document-link.url: https://info.undp.org/docs/pdc/Documents/UGA/Signed UNDP GCF Uganda Project Document dated 23rd Aug 2017.pdf

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2018-2021. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: Others
Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: Reduction or redistribution of unpaid care work

Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: Regulation of identity, tenancy rights, inheritance, marital status
Country has national plans of action for prevention of violent extremism (PVE) under implementation
Country has operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of: Economic shocks
Country has operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of: Other risk factors

Only applies to crisis-affected countries: Country is supported by UNDP, upon request, with targeted interventions to strengthen core government functions for sustainable recovery and improved service delivery (Note: This indicator is reported on an annual basis, not cumulative. Please report expected and actual achievement for the reporting year only, excluding baseline values.)

Only applies to crisis-affected countries: Critical benchmarks for local economic revitalisation (LER) are met (Note: This indicator is reported on an annual basis, not cumulative. Please report expected and actual achievement for the reporting year only, excluding baseline values.)
Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: Access to and control over assets and services
Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: Discrimination in labour markets (formal and informal sectors)
Country has adopted, with UNDP support, legal, policy and institutional reforms to remove structural barriers to women’s empowerment: SGBV
Country has data-informed development and investment plans that incorporate integrated solutions to reduce disaster risks and enable climate change adaptation and mitigation
Country has data-informed development and investment plans that incorporate integrated solutions to reduce disaster risks and enable climate change adaptation and mitigation
Country has improved capacities for dialogue, consensus-building and reconciliation around contested issues, with equal participation of women and men
Country has improved capacities for dialogue, consensus-building and reconciliation around contested issues, with equal participation of women and men
Country has operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of: Health shocks (e.g. pandemics)
Country has operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of: Natural hazards
Country has public-private partnerships at national level to improve the enabling framework for economic diversification and green growth
Country has public-private partnerships at national level to improve the enabling framework for economic diversification and green growth

Country has strengthened capacities for achieving energy transformation at scale: Growth in installed base of power generation from clean and/or renewable energy sources (If YES, please provide Number of installations)

Country has strengthened capacities for achieving energy transformation at scale: Solutions applied at scale to accelerate transition to improved energy efficiency and clean energy (If YES, please provide Number of solutions applied)

Country has strengthened capacities for achieving energy transformation at scale: Volume of investment leveraged from public and private sources through UNDP support for national programmes/initiatives (If YES, please provide volume of investment leveraged US$)

Country has targets for low emission and climate-resilient development Budgets
